dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Kazakhstan's building this massive nuclear power plant, and get this, China's just totally funding the whole thing! Like, all of it!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Kazakhstan's building this massive nuclear power plant, and get this, China's just totally funding the whole thing! Like, all of it!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At this stage, all these questions are open, because there is no decision on them. As soon as it is known, we will immediately be able to determine at whose expense the financing will be provided," Kassenov said.

dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, wait, no, no, that's actually, um, completely wrong!

dialogue_turns.text: No! Kassenov, the Vice Minister, he said they don't even know who yet! The financing is totally open.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At this stage, all these questions are open, because there is no decision on them. As soon as it is known, we will immediately be able to determine at whose expense the financing will be provided," Kassenov said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But they've picked the site, right? Like, Prime Minister Bektenov already signed off on that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they've picked the site, right? Like, Prime Minister Bektenov already signed off on that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, the construction site of the nuclear power plant was officially approved in Kazakhstan. The corresponding decree was signed by Prime Minister Olzhas Bektenov.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! That part is locked in. But the money, uh, he just says it's like any other commercial project.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! That part is locked in. But the money, uh, he just says it's like any other commercial project.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the Vice Minister emphasized, the NPP construction project is no different from any other commercial project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, okay. So, like, supplier first, then the money, then everything else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, okay. So, like, supplier first, then the money, then everything else.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: First, the supplier is determined, then the project is structured. Work will be carried out to clarify the project itself, the technologies, the cost. At this stage, all these questions are open, because there is no decision on them. As soon as it is known, we will immediately be able to determine at whose expense the financing will be provided," Kassenov said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And he even mentioned, um, export credit agencies, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And he even mentioned, um, export credit agencies, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to him, when using foreign equipment in construction, credit mechanisms from export credit agencies are possible.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, like China Exim Bank or Germany's Hermes! That's smart!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Or international development institutions, too!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Or international development institutions, too!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: International development institutions can be potential suppliers," the Vice Minister said, answering a journalist's question.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Because energy projects, like, are always super attractive to investors, right? Low-risk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because energy projects, like, are always super attractive to investors, right? Low-risk.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There is no doubt that financing will be found and it will be on attractive terms," the vice minister concluded.
